oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Discharge paper for Private Lafayette Ketcham
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Discharge of LaFayette Ketcham, Private of Company E, 120th Indiana Infantry Volunteers, discharged by reason of "Surgeons Certificate of disability physically unfit to enter or to reenlist in into VRC (Veterans Reserve Corp). Back of document reads "to be discharged by command of Major General Hooker." Document shows note in upper right corner "$10.65 Bounty allowed by No. 274291 Sept. 20 1899. Another note shows "Paid in full with installment bounty Paid April 3, 1863."
